title: HK collector team heads to US for ultra-rare Pokeฬmon card unboxing with Logan Paul, witness $70m card auction
content: A Hong Kong-listed company is making history by leading the cityโs first trading card collecting team to the United States for what industry insiders are calling the most significant Pokeฬmon card event ever held.MemeStrategy will take a delegation to the headquarters of Goldin, the internationally renowned auction platform in the US, on February 16. The Hong Kong team will join YouTuber Logan Paul and Goldin founder Ken Goldin for a live unboxing of ultra-rare 1999 Pokeฬmon cards alongside the auction of the worldโs most expensive Pokeฬmon card โ a PSA 10-graded "Pikachu Illustrator" card, with market forecasts suggesting the final price could exceed HK$70 million."Pokeฬmon cards have evolved far beyond childhood nostalgia," said Ray Chan, CEO of MemeStrategy. "They have matured into internationally recognized cultural assets with strong appreciation potential and high liquidity."Chan said the company's participation builds a direct bridge between Hong Kong collectors and the world's premier collectibles market, fostering dialogue between local collecting culture and global capital.The event comes as the global trading card market continues its rapid expansion. The market reached US$15.8 billion (around HK$ 123.2 billion) in 2024 and is projected to grow to US$23.5 billion (around HK$ 183.3 billion) by 2030, according to industry data.Pokeฬmon cards have proven particularly lucrative. Data from Card Ladder, cited by The Wall Street Journal, shows the value of Pokeฬmon cards has risen 3,821 percent since 2004, significantly outperforming the S&P 500's 483 percent gain over the same period.The 1999 Pokeฬmon 1st Edition Base Set Booster Box featured in the unboxing of the event is a top-tier collectible. Its 36 booster packs were previously auctioned individually on Goldin's platform, achieving a combined total of US$1.387 million (around HK$10.8 million), with individual packs selling for between US$33,000 and US$45,000 (around HK$257,000 and HK$351,000).The event's other major draw is the auction of Paul's PSA 10 "Pikachu Illustrator" card, widely regarded as the crown jewel of the global Pokeฬmon trading card market.Paul acquired the card in 2022 for approximately US$5.275 million (around HK$41.145 million), setting a Guinness World Record as the "most expensive Pokeฬmon card ever sold."As of now on Goldin, including buyer's premium, the highest bid for the card has reached US$6.324 million (around HK$49.327 million).

title: Hong Kong ranks among global top 10 LEED markets for second straight year
content: Hong Kong has secured a spot among the worldโs top 10 countries and regions for Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design (LEED) for the second consecutive year, the U.S. Green Building Council (USGBC) announced.The city rose one place in the 2025 rankings to sixth globally and fourth in Asia, after adding nearly 100 LEED-certified projects last year, representing a year-on-year increase of about 41 percent.The newly certified area exceeded 3.1 million square meters, or around 34 million square feet, marking a 40 percent increase compared with the previous year.The USGBC said the result further underscores Hong Kongโs position as a leading green building market in Asia and reflects its long-term commitment to highly efficient, sustainable, and scalable development.โAs a major international financial hub, Hong Kongโs market structure is well-positioned to integrate sustainable building performance into decisions about financing, long-term investment, and asset management,โ said Jing Wang, vice president of USGBC and GBCI North Asia.LEED Operations and Maintenance (O+M) certifications have continued to account for a growing share of total certifications, rising from about 20 percent in 2021 to 45 percent in 2025.The shift indicates that LEED O+M has become one of the primary certification types in Hong Kong, signaling a move away from Interior Design and Construction (LEED ID+C) toward greater emphasis on operational performance and long-term environmental outcomes.Several major projects in Hong Kong achieved LEED certification over the past year, including The Henderson and The Quayside, both of which attained the highest Platinum level.The USGBC also noted a clear trend of LEED certification expanding beyond individual buildings to portfolio-level applications. In 2024, Hongkong Land achieved LEED certification for its Central portfolio, while multiple major buildings at Taikoo Place were certified during 2025.

title: General : Littering: 141 Cases Approved For Prosecution - SWCorp
content: KUALA LUMPUR, Feb 4 (Bernama) -- As of yesterday, 141 cases involving the offence of littering under the Solid Waste and Public Cleansing Management Act 2007 (Act 672) have been approved for prosecution by the Deputy Public Prosecutor since Jan 1. Solid Waste and Public Cleansing Management Corporation (SWCorp) chief executive officer Khalid Mohamed said 46 cases have obtained court mention dates. โSo far, three cases have been resolved, and sentences have been handed down by the court. For such an offence, the court may impose a fine of up to RM2,000 or a Community Service Order of up to 12 hours, subject to the facts of the case and the courtโs discretion,โ he said when appearing as a guest on Bernama TVโs Ruang Bicara programme today. In addition, he said notices of offence have been issued to 600 individuals, of whom 462 are locals, while 138 are foreigners. โThis shows that we do not practise selective enforcement of this Act. Anyone on Malaysian soil who litters, based on our observations, will be prosecuted,โ he stressed. Khalid said SWCorp is only responsible for states that have adopted Act 672, namely Johor, Melaka, Negeri Sembilan, Kuala Lumpur and Putrajaya, Kedah, Perlis and Pahang, while solid waste management in other states remains under the jurisdiction of their respective state governments, local authorities and agencies. โThis matter is still at the coordination stage. Several states have already decided on dates for the Act to come into force,โ he said. On enforcement mechanisms, Khalid said SWCorp officers conduct patrols in plain clothes at any time, in addition to recording offenders in the act of littering before taking further action. During the Dewan Rakyat sitting today, Housing and Local Government Minister Nga Kor Ming said all offenders convicted by the court for littering offences will carry out Community Service Orders simultaneously on Feb 13. He said the offenders will serve their sentences by cleaning drains, sweeping roads and washing public toilets, in accordance with their court convictions. -- BERNAMA BERNAMA provides up-to-date authentic and comprehensive news and information which are disseminated via BERNAMA Wires; www.bernama.com; BERNAMA TV on Astro 502, unifi TV 631 and MYTV 121 channels and BERNAMA Radio on FM93.9 (Klang Valley), FM107.5 (Johor Bahru), FM107.9 (Kota Kinabalu) and FM100.9 (Kuching) frequencies. title: How this simple practice can transform your life
content: Cultivating gratitude can have a transformative effect on your life. It is a simple practice that can improve your mental well-being, strengthen relationships, and increase overall happiness. By focusing on the positive aspects of life, you can develop a more optimistic outlook. Here are five effective ways to cultivate gratitude daily, each offering unique insights into how you can incorporate this practice into your everyday routine. Keeping a gratitude journal is an easy way to reflect on what you're thankful for. Every day, write down three to five things you are grateful for. This exercise helps in recognizing the good things in life, even when times are tough. Over time, it can help shift your focus from negative thoughts to positive experiences. Mindful meditation also encourages you to be present and appreciate the moment. By focusing on your breath and letting go of distractions, you can cultivate a sense of gratitude for the present. This practice helps in reducing stress and increasing awareness of the positive aspects of life. Expressing gratitude verbally also strengthens relationships and fosters a sense of connection with others. Take time to thank people in your life who have made a difference, be it through small gestures or significant support. Verbal expressions of gratitude reinforce positive interactions and create a supportive environment. Reflecting on positive memories also helps you relive joyful moments that you might have forgotten. By revisiting these memories, you reinforce feelings of gratitude associated with them. This practice not only boosts your mood but also reminds you of the good times that have contributed to your happiness. Engaging in acts of kindness also creates a cycle of gratitude between you and those you help. Whether it's volunteering or simply lending a hand to someone in need, these actions foster feelings of appreciation from both sides. Kindness not only benefits others but also enriches your own sense of gratitude.
creator: pallabi chatterjee

title: Wall push-ups: 5 benefits you probably didn't know
content: Wall push-ups are a simple yet effective exercise that can be done anywhere. They are a great way to improve upper body strength and flexibility without requiring any special equipment. By performing wall push-ups regularly, you can experience several benefits that contribute to overall fitness and well-being. Here are five surprising benefits of incorporating wall push-ups into your routine. Wall push-ups are a great way to build upper body strength, especially in the chest, shoulders, and triceps. Unlike regular push-ups, which require more strength as they are performed on the floor, wall push-ups are easier and can be done by anyone. As you progress, you can increase the number of repetitions or try different variations to keep challenging your muscles. Doing wall push-ups regularly can help you improve your posture by strengthening the muscles that keep your spine aligned. Stronger back and shoulder muscles help you keep your upper body upright and reduce slouching. This is especially beneficial for people who sit for long hours at work or study. Wall push-ups also help in increasing flexibility, particularly in the shoulders and wrists. The movement requires a full range of motion, which helps in loosening tight muscles and joints over time. Improved flexibility not only helps in better performance in other exercises but also minimizes the risk of injury. While wall push-ups are primarily a strength-building exercise, they also have cardiovascular benefits when performed in a rhythmic manner with minimal rest between sets. This continuous movement increases your heart rate slightly, promoting better circulation and heart health over time. Incorporating wall push-ups into your exercise routine can help with weight management by boosting metabolism and building lean muscle mass. While they may not burn as many calories as high-intensity workouts do, doing them regularly contributes to an increase in overall daily energy expenditure. This makes it easier to maintain or achieve a healthy weight when combined with other physical activities and a balanced diet.
creator: pallabi chatterjee

title: Planning to tour Kenya? Read on
content: Kenya is famous for its wildlife reserves, drawing millions of tourists every year. However, not all reserves live up to the hype. Some places can be a bit overrated, leaving visitors wanting more. Here's a look at some of the most overrated wildlife reserves in Kenya and why they may not be as great as they seem. Maasai Mara is synonymous with Kenya's wildlife tourism. While it is an amazing reserve, it is often crowded and expensive. The high season brings in a lot of tourists, making it difficult to enjoy a peaceful experience. Moreover, the cost of staying here can be exorbitant, with many lodges charging premium rates even during off-peak times. Amboseli National Park is famous for its views of Mount Kilimanjaro and large elephant herds. However, the park's small size limits wildlife viewing opportunities compared to other reserves like Tsavo or Laikipia. During dry seasons, water sources dry up, resulting in fewer animals in the park and less diverse sightings for visitors. Lake Nakuru National Park is famous for its flamingo population, but the birds have been less frequent in recent years due to ecological changes in the lake's water levels and algae growth. While the park has other attractions such as rhinos and giraffes, those expecting a flamingo spectacle may be disappointed. Tsavo East and Tsavo West are two parts of one of Africa's largest national parks. While both offer unique landscapes and wildlife experiences, many travelers find little difference between them apart from accommodation options and accessibility. Some even argue that they offer similar experiences at different price points without significant differences in terms of wildlife sightings or scenery.
creator: pallabi chatterjee

title: Fix upper back skin dryness with these remedies
content: Upper back skin dryness can be a common concern, especially during seasonal changes. This area is often neglected in skincare routines, yet it requires proper care to maintain its health and appearance. Using natural remedies can be an effective way to combat dryness without resorting to harsh chemicals. Here are five practical ways to keep your upper back skin moisturized and healthy. Aloe vera gel is a natural moisturizer that works wonders for dry skin. It is soothing, hydrating, and has anti-inflammatory properties. To use it, extract fresh gel from an aloe vera leaf and apply it directly onto the upper back. Leave it on for about 20 minutes before rinsing off with lukewarm water. Regular use can help reduce dryness and improve skin texture. Coconut oil is known for its deep moisturizing properties owing to its fatty acids. Massaging coconut oil onto the upper back can lock in moisture and prevent further dryness. Warm a small amount of coconut oil in your hands and gently massage it into the skin in circular motions until fully absorbed. This remedy is especially beneficial during colder months when skin tends to lose moisture rapidly. Oatmeal has soothing properties that can relieve dry and irritated skin. For an oatmeal bath soak, grind plain oats into a fine powder and add them to warm bathwater. Soak in this mixture for about 15 minutes to let the oats work their magic on your skin. This remedy not only hydrates but also calms any itching or irritation caused by dryness. Honey is a natural humectant that draws moisture into the skin, making it an excellent remedy for dryness. To make a honey face mask, apply raw honey evenly over the upper back area where dryness is prevalent. Leave it on for 30 minutes before rinsing off with warm water. Honey also has antibacterial properties that can help keep your skin clear. Olive oil is rich in antioxidants and vitamins E and K, which nourish the skin deeply. For treating upper back dryness, warm some olive oil slightly and massage it gently onto the affected area until absorbed completely. This treatment not only moisturizes but also helps in repairing damaged skin cells over time, making your upper back healthier overall.
creator: pallabi chatterjee

title: Everyone loves these Slovenian snacks
content: Slovenia's rich culinary heritage is reflected in its diverse range of snacks, which are a must-try for any food lover. These snacks offer a glimpse into the country's culture and traditions, making them an integral part of Slovenian life. From savory pastries to sweet treats, these snacks are easily available and offer a delightful experience for those exploring Slovenia's gastronomic scene. Potica is a traditional Slovenian pastry that has become a favorite. It is a rolled dough filled with various fillings such as walnuts, poppy seeds, or tarragon. This pastry is usually served during special occasions and celebrations, but can be enjoyed any time of the year. Its unique texture and flavor make it a must-try snack for anyone visiting Slovenia. Prekmurska gibanica is a layered cake from the Prekmurje region of Slovenia. The cake has layers of poppy seeds, apples, walnuts, and cheese wrapped in thin sheets of dough. This dessert is famous for its rich flavors and textures that blend perfectly together. It is usually served at festive occasions but can be found at many bakeries across the country. Kranjska klobasa is a traditional Slovenian dish seasoned with garlic and pepper. This savory snack is usually enjoyed as part of a hearty breakfast or as an accompaniment to other dishes during meals throughout the day. Its robust flavor makes it popular among locals and tourists alike who want to experience authentic Slovenian cuisine. Struklji are rolled dough delicacies filled with various fillings such as cheese or apples wrapped in thin layers of pastry dough. They can be boiled or baked depending on preference. These versatile snacks can be served either sweet or savory, making them suitable for any occasion. They are available at restaurants across Slovenia all year round. Oblivion is a sweet pastry filled with nuts, honey, and sugar syrup. It is baked until golden brown. This delicious treat is commonly served during the Christmas season. It is available at local bakeries throughout the year. Oblivion is loved by many for its rich taste and delightful aroma. It makes it an ideal snack option for anyone visiting Slovenia.
creator: pallabi chatterjee

title: Swiss nimmt zweiten Airbus A350 in Flotte auf
content: Das neue Flugzeug mit dem Namen ยซDeleฬmontยป macht gemaฬss jetzigen Planungen seinen ersten Passagierflug am 23. Februar von Zuฬrich nach Montreal, wie die Lufthansa-Tochter am Mittwoch in einem Communiqueฬ bekannt gab. Ab dem Sommerflugplan 2026 werde der Flugzeugtyp auf der Langstrecke nach Boston und nach Seoul eingesetzt. Im Verlauf des Jahres kommen weitere A350 zur Flotte hinzu. Insgesamt hat die Swiss 10 A350 bestellt. Damit modernisiert sie die Langstreckenflotte. Zudem werden die bisherigen Langstreckenflieger Airbus A330 aufgemoฬbelt. Noch in diesem Jahr beginne bei diesen Maschinen der Einbau einer neuen Kabine.

title: T20 World Cup 2026: Ishan Kishan`s fifty helps India post 240 runs vs SA
content: In the T20 World Cup 2026 warm-up match against South Africa, India posted a total of 240 runs for the loss of six wickets in 20 overs at the Dr DY Patil Sports Academy in Navi Mumbai.Opening the innings for Team India, Ishan Kishan smashed 53 runs off just 20 deliveries, which was laced with two boundaries and seven maximums. Fellow opening batsman Abhishek Sharma scored 24 runs in 18 balls, including three boundaries and a maximum.Tilak Varma, who has returned after an injury, played a knock of 45 runs after facing 19 balls. The left-handed batsman also smashed three boundaries and the same number of maximums. Skipper Suryakumar Yadav also accumulated 30 runs in 16 balls, with the help of two boundaries and the same number of maximums.More updates to follow...
creator: mid-day

title: Maharashtra govt approves separate budget head for `One Stop Centres` for women
content: Ahead of the Maharashtra Budget 2026, the state on Wednesday approved a separate budget head to cover the daily operational expenses of One Stop Centres (OSCs) established for women in distress under the Centre-sponsored Mission Shakti scheme, reported the PTI.The Maharashtra legislatureโs Budget session is scheduled to begin on February 23.The newly created budget head will fund the routine management and day-to-day functioning of OSCs operating under the Sambal sub-scheme. These centres provide integrated support services such as psychological counselling, medical assistance, police support, temporary shelter and legal aid.The move aims to ensure uninterrupted funding for the centresโ ongoing operations.Earlier, an existing budget head was being used primarily for infrastructure-related expenses of OSCs. The government said a distinct accounting head was necessary to ensure that routine operational costs are met smoothly.The decision was announced through a government resolution (GR) issued by the Women and Child Development Department.Central funding and administrative oversightThe approval falls under the Social Security and Welfare category and will be funded 100 per cent by the Centre.The Commissioner of Women and Child Development, Pune, has been appointed as the controlling authority for expenditure under the scheme. The accounts officer of the commissionerate will act as the drawing and disbursing officer.State to consider renaming Ladki Bahin scheme after Ajit PawarMaharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis on Wednesday said the state government would consider a proposal to rename the Ladki Bahin welfare scheme after late Deputy Chief Minister and NCP leader Ajit Pawar.The demand was raised on Tuesday by NCP MLC Amol Mitkari, who suggested that the governmentโs flagship Mukhyamantri Majhi Ladki Bahin Yojana, which provides financial assistance to women, should be renamed in Pawarโs memory.Speaking to reporters in Haridwar, CM Fadnavis said, โThere are several demands. We will sit together and decide how to proceed.โAjit Pawar, a senior Nationalist Congress Party leader, died along with four others in a plane crash at Baramati in Pune district on January 28.Mitkari said Pawar, fondly known as Ajitdada, enjoyed strong support among women across Maharashtra.โDuring his yatras, his wrists would be full of rakhis. Renaming the scheme as Ajitdadanchi Ladki Bahin Yojana would be a fitting tribute by the state government,โ Mitkari said.
creator: mid-day

title: Two injured after gas-filled bundle of balloons explode inside lift in Mumbai
content: Two people were injured after a gas-filled bundle of balloons exploded inside a lift of a building in Mumbai`s Goregaon, officials said on Wednesday, adding the the police has launched a probe into the matter.According to the police, the incident took place on February 2, 2026, at around 10:30 pm."Two people sustained serious burn injuries after a bunch of air-filled balloons exploded inside a lift at a residential building in Goregaon West," a police said.The injured have been identified as Himani Gagan Tapariya (21), a student from Surat in Gujarat and Raju Kumar Mahto (25), a resident of Andheri West.Police said that Tapariya suffered burns to her right hand, neck and abdomen, while Mahto sustained burns to his face.What happenedTapariya had travelled to Mumbai for an admission interview and was heading to her auntโs residence on the 10th floor of Anmol Tower. She entered the lift when Mahto and his associates also boarded, carrying 10 to 12 air-filled balloons.Mahto reportedly works for an event management company that supplies balloons and decorations for parties. As the lift ascended, the balloons suddenly exploded, causing panic and severe injuries to both occupants.A 21-year-old woman was seriously injured after air-filled balloons exploded inside a lift in Goregaon West, Mumbai, on February 2 around 10.30 pm. The woman, Himani Gagan Tapariya from Surat, had entered the lift at Anmol Tower when an unidentified man carrying 10โ12 balloons... pic.twitter.com/9RhEKHy8NMโ Mid Day (@mid_day) February 4, 2026Police said the balloons were allegedly ordered by Arpit Jain, a resident of Room No. 1003, Anmol Tower.A preliminary inquiry revealed that Mahto was not provided with any safety equipment while handling the balloons.A police officer said the incident appears to have been caused by negligence and careless conduct on the part of the employer.Cops begin probeBased on Tapariyaโs statement, the Goregaon Police registered a case under relevant sections of the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita (BNS). The employer, Tripurari Kumar Jaisawal, has been booked in connection with the incident.Both injured individuals were rushed to separate hospitals and are currently undergoing treatment and an investigation was underway, police said.

title: Stan Wawrinka verdient sich das Duell mit Auger-Aliassime
content: Nach dem erfolgreichen Start in seine Abschiedssaison in Melbourne setzte sich der 40-jaฬhrige Waadtlaฬnder in Suฬdfrankreich gegen Hamad Medjedovic mit 7:6 (7:3), 6:4 durch. Wawrinka (ATP 113) gewann gegen den 18 Jahre juฬngeren und in der Weltrangliste 33 Plaฬtze besser klassierten Serben nicht zuletzt die wichtigen Punkte. Den ersten Umgang entschied er im Tiebreak fuฬr sich, nachdem ihm als Returnspieler zuvor nur fuฬnf Punkte gelungen waren. Im zweiten Satz erspielte er sich die ersten Breakbaฬlle und ging dank zweier Servicedurchbruฬche vorentscheidend mit 4:1 in Fuฬhrung. Im Achtelfinal bekommt es Wawrinka am Donnerstag mit dem topgesetzten Feฬlix Auger-Aliassime zu tun, der Nummer 8 des ATP-Rankings. Einen Top-10-Spieler schlug der Schweizer letztmals im Oktober 2024 (die damalige Nummer 7 Andrej Rublew in Stockholm).

title: Psagot to represent BlackRockโs TASE iShare funds
content: Psagot Investment House has been appointed as the operational representative for the foreign funds of investment giant BlackRock in Israel. Psagot Investment House has been appointed to serve as the operational representative of the foreign funds in Israel of investment giant BlackRock, which is responsible for the activities of the funds in Israel with the regulator and the Tel Aviv Stock Exchange (TASE). BlackRock's iShares funds, one of the world's largest asset managers, are among the world's leading investment brands, and 23 of them are traded on the TASE. BlackRock manages assets worth about $14 trillion, as of December 2025, operates more than 70 offices in 30 countries, and has clients in 100 countries around the world. This latest move positions the Israeli investment house at the forefront of the interface between the international investment world and the Israeli investor, and strengthens its status as a leading and innovative investment house, offering its clients advanced global investment solutions. BlackRock Israel said, "BlackRock is proud of the major growth that we have seen in local funds with the support of the Israel office, and we will continue to operate with no changes with financial advisors and institutional bodies to realize the potential in the local market." Psagot CEO Tsachi Iron added, "The appointment of Psagot as the representative for the foreign funds of BlackRock in Israel is a strategic move that brings Psagot in line with advanced international standards, and demonstrates the diverse capabilities of Psagot as an investment house that stands at the forefront of technological innovation in all matters relating to financial solutions." Psagot Investment House, which is the oldest investment house in Israel, is experiencing growth momentum and is continually expanding its areas of activity. About a year ago, it launched "Psagot Trade" - a new platform for independent trading in the capital market, and one of the most advanced and innovative in Israel. The platform provides investors with direct access to the capital markets in Israel, the US, Canada and Europe and enables the purchase and sale of all types of securities, using advanced AI capabilities. title: Did Epstein Really Die? Chilling โPrison Swapโ Claims Resurface in New DOJ Files
content: Newly released Department of Justice files are breathing fresh life into one of the most controversial conspiracy theories surrounding Jeffrey Epsteinโs death. A long-debunked claim, that Epstein was secretly swapped with another inmate before his suicide, is trending again after documents revealed a federal probe into a mysterious 4Chan post made on the morning he died. While officials maintain Epstein died by suicide, unanswered questions, resurfacing names, and millions of pages of files are reigniting public fascination with the case.

title: โTrump Wonโt Dare To Attackโ: Iran MP Teases US For โLosing War Confidenceโ Ahead Of Nuclear Talks
content: For weeks, tensions in the Middle East hovered on the edge of open conflict โ warships deployed, drones downed, and threats flying. Now, a stunning claim from Tehran suggests the balance may be shifting. An Iranian lawmaker says the risk of war with the United States has dropped sharply, not because of diplomacy, but because Washington doubts it can secure a decisive victory. While weapons remain positioned and pressure continues, cracks reportedly also appear inside the White House over the cost of escalation. Watch

title: PUIC calls for end to occupation of Palestinian territories
content: NOUAKCHOTT, Feb. 4 (Xinhua) -- The Executive Committee of the Parliamentary Union of the Organization of Islamic Cooperation Member States (PUIC) concluded its 55th session on Tuesday in Nouakchott, the capital of Mauritania, urging intensified efforts to end Israel's occupation of Palestinian territories. According to the Mauritanian News Agency, the Nouakchott Declaration, issued at the closing of the session, strongly condemned the "continued Israeli aggression against the Gaza Strip, the West Bank, and Jerusalem," describing these actions as a "flagrant violation of international law." Participants called on the international community to enable the Palestinian people to establish their independent state. The declaration also welcomed the recognition of the State of Palestine by a majority of nations. On broader global governance, the participants called for the launch of a "New Alliance of Virtue," an initiative to promote a "more just and equitable global order" and to enhance the role of the Islamic world in international decision-making mechanisms. The declaration also warned against the dangers of "double standards" in international relations, noting that such practices threaten global peace and undermine trust in the international system. โ

title: India revokes direct rule in Manipur, new chief minister takes oath
content: NEW DELHI, Feb. 4 (Xinhua) -- India's federal government on Wednesday revoked the direct rule imposed in the restive northeastern state of Manipur in February last year, the state-run broadcaster All India Radio (AIR) said. Yumnam Khemchand Singh, a Bharatiya Janata Party leader, took oath as the new chief minister of Manipur on Wednesday evening. Earlier in the day, Khemchand Singh met the state's Governor Ajay Kumar Bhalla and staked a claim to form a new local government in the state. Last year in February, the then chief minister N Biren Singh resigned, two years after deadly ethnic violence broke out in the northeastern state, which claimed 258 lives and displaced over 60,000. โ

title: Equatorial Guinea, Cameroon agree on joint exploitation of border gas fields
content: YAOUNDE, Feb. 4 (Xinhua) -- Equatorial Guinea and Cameroon have agreed to jointly exploit gas deposits in the border towns of Yoyo and Yolanda, Cameroon's Ministry of Mines, Industry and Technological Development said on Wednesday. The unitization agreement for the Yoyo-Yolanda gas field, a transboundary gas deposit shared between the locality of Yoyo in Cameroon and Yolanda in Equatorial Guinea, was signed on Tuesday in Malabo, the capital of Equatorial Guinea. While addressing officials at the event, Vice President of Equatorial Guinea Teodoro Nguema Obiang Mangue described the agreement as "historic." "The achievements of the signed agreement demonstrate that sincere cooperation is the most direct path to efficient management of shared natural resources," said the vice president. The agreement marked a milestone in bilateral relations, establishing a framework of technical and economic cooperation geared toward generating income and creating job opportunities for both countries, he added. โ

title: Astronomers make direct detection of cosmic ray's influence on star formation
content: JERUSALEM, Feb. 4 (Xinhua) -- An international team of scientists has for the first time measured the effect of cosmic rays inside a star-forming nebula, the Israel Institute of Technology said in a statement on Wednesday. Stars and planets form in cold, dense clouds of gas and dust, where cosmic rays are the dominant source of ionization and heating. Cosmic rays are high-energy particles, including protons, electrons, and atomic nuclei, that move near light speed and help drive star formation. Scientists have been using the cosmic-ray ionization rate, the rate at which cosmic rays ionize molecular hydrogen per second, to describe the chemical, physical, and thermal state of star-forming regions. In previous studies, astronomers observed ionization primarily through chemical line observations and models. This roundabout approach may lead to highly variable results. In the latest research published in Nature Astronomy, the team observed nebula Barnard 68 with James Webb Space Telescope, measuring extremely faint infrared lines that arise when cosmic rays directly excite the gas. Astronomers have theorized about these directly excited lines for decades, yet direct observations remain elusive. The team led by the Israel Institute of Technology detected a faint glow of directly stimulated molecular hydrogen. It is the first time that cosmic rays are observationally confirmed to stimulate measurable infrared lines directly. The researchers said their study opens a transformative observational window into the origin, propagation and role of cosmic rays in star formation and galaxy evolution. They have been approved to use James Webb Space Telescope to study another cloud. โ

title: Ghana begins 2026 with eased inflation at 3.8 pct in January
content: ACCRA, Feb. 4 (Xinhua) -- Ghana's consumer inflation rate eased further to 3.8 percent in January, a 1.6-percentage-point decline compared to the 5.4 percent recorded the previous month, according to data from the Ghana Statistical Service (GSS) on Wednesday. "This is the 13th consecutive decline in inflation since January last year and a 19.7-percentage-point decline over the same period," said Government Statistician Alhassan Iddrisu during a press briefing in Accra, the Ghanaian capital. Iddrisu said the lower inflation rate was due to falling commodity prices, with persistent low food inflation. "Compared to December, food inflation declined 1 percentage point to 3.9 percent in January, while non-food inflation also declined to 3.9 percent from the previous month's level of 5.8 percent," Iddrisu said. Meanwhile, the inflation rate for locally produced and imported items stood at 4.5 percent and 2 percent, respectively, in January, compared to 5.9 percent and 4.3 percent, respectively, a month earlier. The steady drop in inflation from 23.5 percent in January 2025 to 3.8 percent in January 2026, according to Iddrisu, showed a sustained shift in prices and signals that Ghana is firmly on the path to macroeconomic stability. In late January, Ghana's central bank cut its benchmark lending rate by a further 250 basis points to 15.5 percent to boost growth as inflation remains firmly tamed. โ

title: European youth hold overall positive image of China: survey
content: BEIJING, Feb. 4 (Xinhua) -- A significant 82 percent of Europeans hold a positive view of China, including 19 percent who hold a "very" positive opinion, according to a survey report released on Wednesday. The "China in the Eyes of European Youth" survey polled 19,025 Europeans aged 18 to 35 across 36 countries. It was carried out by France-based CSA Research, and commissioned by the Institute of European Studies, Chinese Academy of Social Sciences (CASS), and the China-CEE Institute in Hungary. China's image is strongest in Southeast Europe and the Balkans, as well as in Spain and Britain, according to the survey. The report notes that 63 percent of respondents are optimistic about the future development of China-Europe relations, and that optimism is rooted in trade and interdependence. The surveyed youth listed economic and trade cooperation, and sci-tech innovation as the top priorities for future China-Europe cooperation. The report also reveals the consumption preferences of young Europeans. A total of 40 percent of respondents said they would prioritize Chinese products if given the choice, with higher rates among respondents from Eastern Europe. Of the respondents who had visited China, 61 percent said they prioritize Chinese products "always or often." That figure rises to 74 percent among those who are frequently exposed to Chinese culture. Electronics, tech devices, toys, games, textiles and apparel are particularly popular among European youth, the survey showed. The majority of respondents said that they believe China is closely linked to their daily lives, and that they are generally optimistic about the future of China-Europe cooperation, which lays an important social foundation for the development of China-Europe ties, said Feng Zhongping, director of the CASS Institute of European Studies. โ

title: South Africa officially joins Afreximbank as Class A shareholder
content: JOHANNESBURG, Feb. 4 (Xinhua) -- South Africa on Wednesday officially acceded to the Establishment Agreement of the African Export-Import Bank (Afreximbank), a move President Cyril Ramaphosa described as a major milestone in advancing Africa's economic integration, industrial development and intra-continental trade. Speaking at the accession signing ceremony held in Johannesburg, Ramaphosa said that South Africa's accession to Afreximbank affirms the country's commitment to African industrial development and to deeper trade, investment and development across the continent. The ceremony marked South Africa's formal transition to Class A shareholder status in Afreximbank and the launch of a strategic partnership aimed at promoting industrial development, export-led growth and deeper intra-African trade integration. "We seek to contribute to an Africa that prioritizes intra-continental trade, that builds its own industrial base, and that mobilizes African financial institutions to support development," Ramaphosa said. He said the focus is on translating the partnership into practical instruments to expand productive capacity, diversify exports and integrate more South Africans into regional and global value chains. Afreximbank is a pan-African multilateral trade finance institution established in 1993, with an aim to the expansion and diversification of African trade and increasing the continent's share of global trade. โ

title: African Mining Indaba 2026 set to boost public-private collaboration
content: CAPE TOWN, Feb. 4 (Xinhua) -- The Investing in African Mining Indaba 2026, to be held next week in Cape Town, South Africa's legislative capital, will focus on strengthening public-private collaboration, South Africa's Department of Trade, Industry and Competition (DTIC) said on Tuesday. The event, set to take place at the Cape Town International Convention Center from Feb. 9 to 12 under the theme "Stronger together: Progress through partnerships," is expected to attract over 10,500 attendees, including more than 1,300 global investors, 1,400 government officials from across Africa and 1,450 mining companies. "The Investing in African Mining Indaba remains the world's largest mining investment conference, drawing governments, global mining companies, original equipment manufacturers, technology firms, financiers, and development institutions," the DTIC said in a statement. The department noted that the 2026 event provides an important opportunity to reinforce South Africa's investment appeal in critical minerals. In the statement, the DTIC announced that during the Indaba, it will host a Joint Mining Indaba Investment Forum on Feb. 9, which will see a high-level panel of ministers and private-sector representatives leading discussions on enabling South Africa's critical minerals strategy, as well as advancing industrialization, beneficiation and sustainable value-chain development. "It will showcase investor-ready projects and provide an opportunity for global investors to share market perspectives," said the department. โ

title: Britain's services sector expands in January
content: LONDON, Feb. 4 (Xinhua) -- Britain's services sector expanded in January, with the seasonally adjusted purchasing managers' index (PMI) pointing to an increase in business activity at the start of 2026, according to a report released by S&P Global on Wednesday. The headline S&P Global UK Services PMI Business Activity Index stood at 54.0 in January, up from 51.4 in December 2025, the data showed. Services companies attributed the higher level of business activity to greater confidence among clients, the start of new projects and a post-Budget improvement in investment sentiment. Tim Moore, economics director at S&P Global Market Intelligence, said that output growth was the fastest in five months, supported by an uplift in investment sentiment and stronger new order intakes. But he also cautioned that services providers still reported that consumer demand was constrained by squeezed disposable incomes, while risk aversion in response to geopolitical tensions continued to hold back business spending. "Services sector companies appear cautiously optimistic about their growth prospects for the next 12 months," he said, underlining renewed gloomy signals for the British labour market outlook as staff hiring decreased at a steeper pace in January amid firms' efforts to offset rising payroll costs. โ

title: Piantedosi, su sicurezza lavoro equilibrato, se rilievi prenderemo atto
content: (ANSA) - ROMA, 04 FEB - "Credo che abbiamo fatto un lavoro molto ragionevole e molto equilibrato, altrimenti prenderemo atto dei rilievi fatti". title: South Sudan launches fiscal framework to address economic challenges
content: JUBA, Feb. 4 (Xinhua) -- South Sudan on Wednesday unveiled a new fiscal framework to tackle economic challenges and steer the nation toward stability and sustainable growth. Bak Barnaba Chol, minister of finance and planning, said the policy prioritizes economic stabilization and essential spending. "The framework represents a deliberate program of adjustment, enhancement and rationalization, designed to stabilize the economy, protect livelihoods, and lay the foundation for sustainable and inclusive growth," Chol told journalists in Juba, the capital of South Sudan. The minister said the policy, which reflects collective Cabinet deliberations and inputs from key institutions, including the Bank of South Sudan, the South Sudan Revenue Authority and relevant ministries, came in response to mounting fiscal pressures, high inflation, currency instability and structural imbalances largely driven by over-reliance on oil revenues and limited domestic production. He said the Cabinet assessed the current economic situation and directed the ministry to move beyond fragmented interventions and adopt a coherent stabilization and reform framework grounded in realism, phased implementation and strong institutional coordination. Chol said fiscal discipline and expenditure rationalization are central to the policy, with the government planning to prioritize salaries and essential operations, including security, peace implementation and elections, while limiting payments for non-essential claims and contracts. He said recruitment across government institutions will be temporarily halted, except for clearly justified critical needs. Chol said the reforms also include institutional and diplomatic rationalization aimed at improving the welfare of South Sudan's diplomatic missions, as well as productive sector enhancement to boost public-private partnerships, support small and medium-sized enterprises and diversify the economy. "The government is committed not only to policy articulation, but also to disciplined implementation, transparency and accountability," he said, noting that the policy is Cabinet-owned and reflects collective responsibility for steering South Sudan toward economic resilience. โ

title: Malaysia's Petronas signs 20-year LNG supply agreement with QatarEnergy
content: KUALA LUMPUR, Feb. 4 (Xinhua) -- Petronas LNG Ltd (PLL), a subsidiary of Malaysia's state-owned oil and gas firm Petroliam Nasional Bhd (Petronas), has signed a 20-year liquefied natural gas (LNG) sale and purchase agreement with QatarEnergy, marking the first long-term LNG supply agreement between the two companies. Petronas said in a statement on Wednesday that under the agreement, PLL will offtake up to 2 million tonnes per annum (MTPA) of LNG from QatarEnergy over a period of 20 years. The long-term volumes secured through this agreement will play a critical role in reinforcing Malaysia's energy supply security, ensuring stable and reliable LNG availability to meet growing demand in Malaysia, said the statement. According to the statement, this strategic collaboration enhances Petronas' portfolio resilience amid an evolving global energy landscape, while supporting the nation's economic development and energy transition priorities. โ

title: Polizia locale di Brunico, nel 2025 oltre 34 mila ore di servizio e oltre 8mila infrazioni rilevate
content: ANTERSELVA. Prima di affrontare la nuova sfida legata alle gare di biathlon in occasione dei Giochi olimpici invernali 2026, la Polizia locale ha celebrato il patrono San Sebastiano tracciando il bilancio dellโattivitaฬ svolta nel 2025. Il 20 gennaio, dopo la Santa Messa nella chiesa delle Orsoline, la comandante Lisa Innerbichler ha dato il benvenuto a dipendenti e autoritaฬ, riepilogando un anno che ha visto complessivamente 34.718 ore di servizio prestate sul territorio. Sul fronte della sicurezza stradale, la comandante ha espresso rammarico per le crescenti difficoltaฬ nei controlli di velocitaฬ, legate sia alla sospensione degli speedbox automatici sia alle incertezze giuridiche sullโomologazione dei telelaser. Nonostante cioฬ, sono stati sanzionati 187 conducenti per eccesso di velocitaฬ. Le 8.045 infrazioni al Codice della strada rilevate restano in linea con lโanno precedente, con un aumento delle violazioni per mancato uso delle cinture, assenza di seggiolini per bambini, sorpassi illegali e infrazioni nei cantieri stradali. In lieve calo, invece, il passaggio con il rosso e lโuso del cellulare alla guida. Rilevante anche lโattivitaฬ nei controlli della sosta e della circolazione. Le infrazioni ai divieti di transito , circa 2.000 , sono legate sia alla videosorveglianza in via Europa sia alla maggiore presenza degli agenti nel centro storico e nelle zone scolastiche. Registrate 313 violazioni per sosta su marciapiedi e percorsi pedonali e 87 occupazioni abusive di stalli per disabili , che hanno comportato rimozione dei veicoli, sanzioni da 330 euro e decurtazione di punti patente. Complessivamente sono stati sottratti 1.417 punti , effettuati 59 sequestri e riscontrati 31 veicol i senza revisione valida. Nel 2025 la Polizia locale ha rilevato 53 incidenti stradali , in lieve aumento, con 38 feriti, soprattutto ciclisti, in leggero calo. Accanto ai compiti di viabilitaฬ, lโattivitaฬ ha riguardato oggetti smarriti, cambi di residenza, permessi, interventi in situazioni critiche e controlli ambientali. La comandante ha infine richiamato lโattenzione sullโinasprimento delle sanzioni del Codice della strada, in particolare per lโuso del cellulare alla guida e per le nuove regole sui monopattini elettrici, rivolgendo un appello alla cittadinanza al rispetto delle norme per la sicurezza di tutti.

title: Giovane uccisa, il fratello: "ho lanciato il coltello ma non volevo ucciderla"
content: (ANSA) - NAPOLI, 04 FEB - Ha picchiato la sorella, e mentre lei si stava allontanando per fuggire dalle percosse le ha lanciato un coltello, colpendola alla schiena. E' il racconto, tutto da verificare, che Giuseppe Musella ha fatto agli inquirenti dopo essersi costituito, ammettendo l'aggressione mortale a Jlenia ma sostenendo di non aver avuto intenzione di ucciderla. Le liti tra i due erano frequenti, anche ieri sembra avessero avuto un contrasto percheฬ Jlenia ascoltava musica ad alto volume. Secondo il racconto del giovane, il bisticcio fatale sarebbe peroฬ scoppiato percheฬ il cagnolino di Giuseppe aveva fatto la pipiฬ in casa. Jlenia sferra un calcio alla bestiola facendo andare Giuseppe su tutte le furie. La situazione sembra calmarsi ma solo momentaneamente: Giuseppe racconta che, quando sente il cagnolino guaire dal dolore, le si avventa contro e, oltre alle botte, lancia il coltello. (ANSA).

title: Government lawyer yanked from immigration detail in Minnesota after telling judge โthis job sucksโ
content: By MICHAEL KUNZELMAN and ALANNA DURKIN RICHERWASHINGTON (AP) โ A government lawyer who told a judge that her job โsucksโ during a court hearing stemming from the Trump administrationโs immigration enforcement surge in Minnesota has been removed from her Justice Department post, according to a person familiar with the matter.Related ArticlesTrump says Washington has waited 200 years for the arch he wants to build. Not quiteHow Americansโ top concerns compare to more than 100 other countries, according to GallupTrump and Xi discuss Iran in wide-ranging call as US presses China and others to break from TehranUS-Iran talks to take place Friday in Oman, Iranian media sayGeorgiaโs Fulton County seeks the return of 2020 election documents seized by the FBIJulie Le had been working for the Justice Department on a detail, but the U.S. attorney in Minnesota ended her assignment after her comments in court on Tuesday, the person said. The person spoke on the condition of anonymity to discuss a personnel matter. She had been working for U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement before the temporary assignment.At a hearing Tuesday in St. Paul, Minnesota, for several immigration cases, Le told U.S. District Judge Jerry Blackwell that she wishes he could hold her in contempt of court โso that I can have a full 24 hours of sleep.โโWhat do you want me to do? The system sucks. This job sucks. And I am trying every breath that I have so that I can get you what you need,โ Le said, according to a transcript.Le was assigned at least 88 cases in less than a month, according to online court records. ICE officials have said the surge in Minnesota has become its largest-ever immigration operation since ramping up in early January. Several prosecutors have left the U.S. Attorneyโs office in Minnesota amid frustration with the immigration enforcement surge and the Justice Departmentโs response to fatal shootings of two civilians by federal agents.Blackwell told Le that the volume of cases isnโt an excuse for disregarding court orders. He expressed concern that people arrested in immigration enforcement operations are routinely jailed for days after judges have ordered their release from custody.โAnd I hear the concerns about all the energy that this is causing the DOJ to expend, but, with respect, some of it is of your own making by not complying with orders,โ the judge told Le.Le said she was working for the Department of Homeland Security as an ICE attorney in immigration court...
creator: associated press

title: Government lawyer yanked from immigration detail in Minnesota after telling judge โthis job sucksโ
content: By MICHAEL KUNZELMAN and ALANNA DURKIN RICHERWASHINGTON (AP) โ A government lawyer who told a judge that her job โsucksโ during a court hearing stemming from the Trump administrationโs immigration enforcement surge in Minnesota has been removed from her Justice Department post, according to a person familiar with the matter.Julie Le had been working for the Justice Department on a detail, but the U.S. attorney in Minnesota ended her assignment after her comments in court on Tuesday, the person said. The person spoke on the condition of anonymity to discuss a personnel matter. She had been working for U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement before the temporary assignment.At a hearing Tuesday in St. Paul, Minnesota, for several immigration cases, Le told U.S. District Judge Jerry Blackwell that she wishes he could hold her in contempt of court โso that I can have a full 24 hours of sleep.โโWhat do you want me to do? The system sucks. This job sucks. And I am trying every breath that I have so that I can get you what you need,โ Le said, according to a transcript.Le was assigned at least 88 cases in less than a month, according to online court records. ICE officials have said the surge in Minnesota has become its largest-ever immigration operation since ramping up in early January. Several prosecutors have left the U.S. Attorneyโs office in Minnesota amid frustration with the immigration enforcement surge and the Justice Departmentโs response to fatal shootings of two civilians by federal agents.Blackwell told Le that the volume of cases isnโt an excuse for disregarding court orders. He expressed concern that people arrested in immigration enforcement operations are routinely jailed for days after judges have ordered their release from custody.โAnd I hear the concerns about all the energy that this is causing the DOJ to expend, but, with respect, some of it is of your own making by not complying with orders,โ the judge told Le.Le said she was working for the Department of Homeland Security as an ICE attorney in immigration court before she โstupidlyโ volunteered to work the detail in Minnesota. Le told the judge that she wasnโt properly trained for the assignment. She said she wanted to resign from the job but couldnโt get a replacement.โFixing a system, a broken system, I donโt have a magic button to do it. I donโt have the power or the voice to do it,โ she said.Le and spokespeople for DHS, ICE and the U.S. Attorneyโs office in Minnesota didnโt immediately...

title: Nieuwe tentoonstelling met themaโs als tijd, toeval en bestaan in bovenfoyer Schaffelaartheater
content: In de bovenfoyer van het Schaffelaartheater is sinds begin deze week een nieuwe tentoonstelling te zien. Ditmaal gaat het om een solo-expositie met grote werken van beeldend kunstenaar Yoke Ferwerda uit buurgemeente Ede. De tentoonstelling toont voornamelijk abstracte schilderijen die Ferwerda maakte tussen 2005 en 2015. In haar werk staan themaโs als tijd, toeval en bestaan centraal. ,,We hangen maar wat rond in het universum, met meer of minder succes,โ aldus de kunstenaar. ,,Soms kleurrijk, soms zwart-wit, botsend en spelend met de werkelijkheid.โ Volgens Ferwerda speelt tijd een belangrijke rol in haar werk, ook al is tijd volgens haar een relatief begrip. ,,De schaduwen in mijn schilderijen geven bestaansrecht aan ogenschijnlijk vreemde objecten, net zoals wij dat zelf ook zijn.โ Daarnaast zijn twee portretten uit 2018 te zien, die eerder samen hingen in het oude ENKA-gebouw in Ede tijdens de tentoonstelling Schaft. De portretten vormen een tweeluik. ,,Ze staan voor tegenstellingen als man en vrouw, jong en oud, groen en rood, slapend en wakend,โ licht Ferwerda toe. Meer recent werk van de kunstenaar is te bekijken via .
creator: barneveldse krant

title: Democrats plan DHS funding offer as Thune floats long-term punt
content: Democratic and Republican leaders showed no sign of narrowing their differences on Department of Homeland Security funding Wednesday as a Feb. 13 deadline draws nearer. House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries and Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer reiterated demands for new restrictions on immigration enforcement agencies at a joint news conference. Flanked by other Democratic leaders, the leaders said they plan to submit draft legislation to Republicans by Thursday. โWe're going to have tough, strong legislation,โ Schumer said. โWe want our Republican colleagues to finally get serious about this, because this is turning America inside out.โ Earlier Wednesday, Senate Majority Leader John Thune not only warned that a deal would be next to impossible to consummate before next weekโs deadline but threatened a possible long-term stopgap that would effectively exclude changes to immigration enforcement. Without quick progress in the talks, he said, โit may be the best way to deal with this particular appropriations bill is, do a year-long CR if that's what it takes,โ Thune said, referring to a continuing resolution that would continue existing DHS funding levels through Sept. 30. While the two Democratic leaders reiterated in a news conference that they are โon the same page,โ Jeffries and Schumer declined to draw the same red lines on a full-year DHS punt. Jeffries said after the news conference he is โa hard noโ on a full-year CR, while Schumer stopped short of a hard commitment. โRepublicans shouldn't expect our votes if they're not willing to enact strong, tough reform,โ he said when asked if Senate Democrats would oppose another punt. The list of demands Jeffries and Schumer laid out Wednesday largely tracks with an earlier list of DHS proposals Senate Democrats put forward after the Jan. 24 killing of a Minneapolis man by federal agents there. They include prohibiting masks for federal agents in most circumstances and requiring a judge to sign off on warrants for DHS immigration apprehensions โ proposals that some top Republicans have already rejected. In addition to the policy sparring Wednesday, there was some personal squabbling, too โ including over who should be involved in notching any agreement. Thune suggested any deal needed to be cut primarily between Democrats and the Trump administration. He also warned that he does not view Jeffries as a reliable negotiating partner. โHe's just not, and I think he and, for that matter, Leader Schumer are...

title: After 12 years, MexicoโToluca Train opens with a 186% cost overrun
content: The Government of Mexico inaugurated the MexicoโToluca Interurban Train โEl Insurgenteโ almost 12 years after it was announced, completing a key transportation project with a cost 186% higher than the original estimate. With the opening of the Santa FeโObservatorio section, the train continuously connects the Metropolitan Area of the Valley of Toluca with Mexico City along 57.7km, through seven stations and 20 electric trains 100m in length, with capacity for 719 passengers each and universal accessibility, on a journey of less than 60 minutes. President Claudia Sheinbaum led the inaugural event at the Vasco de Quiroga station and made a trip from Santa Fe to Observatorio. During her speech, she stressed that the project goes beyond the function of transportation. โIt is not only a train that moves people from Toluca to Mexico City, but it is also a completely different vision of reclaiming public space and integrating working-class areas into world-class transportation,โ she said at the daily press conference held at the Cineteca Nacional Chapultepec. According to official information, the MexicoโToluca Train required a total investment of around 100 billion (bn) pesos (US$5.78bn). The project was announced in 2012, at the beginning of Enrique Penฬa Nietoโs six-year term, with an original budget of 35bn pesos and a planned completion date of 2017, while construction work began in 2014. Based on these figures, the final cost reported by the current administration represents an approximate increase of 186% compared to the initial amount. The development faced delays associated with technical, environmental, financial and social adjustments, which extended its execution over three federal administrations. However, despite the figure reported by the authorities, the Secretariat of Infrastructure, Communications and Transport ( SICT ) updated the project cost in January 2025 to 140.135bn pesos in the investment portfolio of the Ministry of Finance and Public Credit (SHCP), which represented a 14% increase compared with the last official amount reported in 2024. Final stretch The secretary of Infrastructure, Communications and Transport, Jesuฬs Esteva, explained that the Santa FeโObservatorio section, 8.4km long, was one of the most technically complex segments. It includes viaducts with prefabricated columns up to 34m high, double-cantilever sections up to 45m, and a 515m-long cable-stayed bridge with double curvature, designed to clear the Ermita Vasco de...

title: Liaison office chief: HK must embrace reform
content: Hong Kong must embrace reform and avoid complacency, said Zhou Ji, Director of the Liaison Office of the Central Peopleโs Government in Hong Kong, at the Chinese New Year gathering held last night at the Hong Kong Convention and Exhibition Centre.Zhou praised the cityโs resilience over the past year, noting how different sectors united to overcome natural disasters and a major fire while successfully holding the Legislative Council election.He expressed confidence that Hong Kong can better coordinate development and security, foster new productive forces, and continue reforms for the benefit of its people. โIt is better to be a reformer facing difficulties than to be a complacent bystander,โ he said.Chief Executive John Lee Ka-chiu also addressed the gathering, pledging that the SAR government will actively align with the national framework, and said that the administration will strengthen its sense of responsibility. Entering the Year of the Horse, he added, Hong Kong will โtake the lead,โ further advancing the principle of executive-led governance and integrating it across different areas to enhance effectiveness.Officials, including Head of the Office for Safeguarding National Security of the Central Peopleโs Government in Hong Kong Dong Jingwei, Commissioner of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in Hong Kong Cui Jianchun and Vice Chairman of the Chinese Peopleโs Political Consultative Conference Leung Chun-ying, attended.

title: Water pipe bursts, crane truck trapped in Tsuen Wan road collapse
content: A burst water pipe caused a road collapse in Tsuen Wan on Wednesday afternoon, trapping a crane truck and forcing overnight repairs and water supply suspension.The incident on Heung Sing Street occurred around 4.30pm. The parked crane truck's front wheel sank into a hole, with its front nearly touching the road surface. Police cordoned off the area.Another crane truck arrived around 9pm to rescue the vehicle, revealing a hole roughly 30 by 30 centimeters. Water Supplies Department (WSD) workers then prepared machinery to enclose the site for repairs.Water supply to buildings on Heung Wo Street (Nos. 1-41), Sha Tsui Road (Nos. 102-144), and the entire Heung Sing Street will be suspended from 11.30pm on Wednesday for emergency repairs, expected to finish around 6.30am on Thursday. The WSD will set up water tanks for affected residents.Preliminary investigations suggest the collapse was caused by a leak in a 100-millimeter diameter fresh water pipe. The WSD planned repairs after the evening usage peak to minimize disruption. The road is temporarily closed, and drivers are advised to use alternative routes. The department apologized for the inconvenience.
